verses.verse: But Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>,
Oh that<WH3863> my grief<WH3708> were throughly<WH8254> weighed<WH8254>, and my calamity<WH1942><WH1962> laid<WH5375> in the balances<WH3976> together<WH3162>!
For now it would be heavier<WH3513> than the sand<WH2344> of the sea<WH3220>: therefore my words<WH1697> are swallowed up<WH3886>.

For the arrows<WH2671> of the Almighty<WH7706> are within<WH5978> me, the poison<WH2534> whereof drinketh up<WH8354> my spirit<WH7307>: the terrors<WH1161> of God<WH433> do set themselves in array<WH6186> against me.
Doth the wild ass<WH6501> bray<WH5101> when he hath grass<WH1877>? or loweth<WH1600> the ox<WH7794> over his fodder<WH1098>?
Can that which is unsavoury<WH8602> be eaten<WH398> without salt<WH4417>? or is there<WH3426> any taste<WH2940> in the white<WH7388> of an egg<WH2495>?
The things that my soul<WH5315> refused<WH3985> to touch<WH5060> are as my sorrowful<WH1741> meat<WH3899>.
Oh that I might have<WH935> my request<WH7596>; and that God<WH433> would grant<WH5414> me the thing that I long for<WH8615>!
Even that it would please<WH2974> God<WH433> to destroy<WH1792> me; that he would let loose<WH5425> his hand<WH3027>, and cut me off<WH1214>!
Then should I yet have comfort<WH5165>; yea, I would harden<WH5539> myself in sorrow<WH2427>: let him not spare<WH2550>; for I have not concealed<WH3582> the words<WH561> of the Holy One<WH6918>.
What is my strength<WH3581>, that I should hope<WH3176>? and what is mine end<WH7093>, that I should prolong<WH748> my life<WH5315>?
Is my strength<WH3581> the strength<WH3581> of stones<WH68>? or is my flesh<WH1320> of brass<WH5153>?
Is not my help<WH5833> in me? and is wisdom<WH8454> driven quite<WH5080> from me?
To him that is afflicted<WH4523> pity<WH2617> should be shewed from his friend<WH7453>; but he forsaketh<WH5800> the fear<WH3374> of the Almighty<WH7706>.
My brethren<WH251> have dealt deceitfully<WH898> as a brook<WH5158>, and as the stream<WH650> of brooks<WH5158> they pass away<WH5674>;
Which are blackish<WH6937> by reason of the ice<WH7140>, and wherein the snow<WH7950> is hid<WH5956>:
What time<WH6256> they wax warm<WH2215>, they vanish<WH6789>: when it is hot<WH2527>, they are consumed out<WH1846> of their place<WH4725>.
The paths<WH734> of their way<WH1870> are turned aside<WH3943>; they go<WH5927> to nothing<WH8414>, and perish<WH6>.
The troops<WH734> of Tema<WH8485> looked<WH5027>, the companies<WH1979> of Sheba<WH7614> waited<WH6960> for them.
They were confounded<WH954> because they had hoped<WH982>; they came<WH935> thither, and were ashamed<WH2659>.
For now ye are nothing; ye see<WH7200> my casting down<WH2866>, and are afraid<WH3372>.
Did I say<WH559>, Bring<WH3051> unto me? or, Give a reward<WH7809> for me of your substance<WH3581>?
Or, Deliver<WH4422> me from the enemy's<WH6862> hand<WH3027>? or, Redeem<WH6299> me from the hand<WH3027> of the mighty<WH6184>?
Teach<WH3384> me, and I will hold my tongue<WH2790>: and cause me to understand<WH995> wherein I have erred<WH7686>.
How forcible<WH4834> are right<WH3476> words<WH561>! but what doth your arguing<WH3198> reprove<WH3198>?
Do ye imagine<WH2803> to reprove<WH3198> words<WH4405>, and the speeches<WH561> of one that is desperate<WH2976>, which are as wind<WH7307>?
Yea, ye overwhelm<WH5307> the fatherless<WH3490>, and ye dig<WH3738> a pit for your friend<WH7453>.
Now therefore be content<WH2974>, look<WH6437> upon me; for it is evident<WH6440> unto you if I lie<WH3576>.
Return<WH7725>, I pray you, let it not be iniquity<WH5766>; yea, return again<WH7725>, my righteousness<WH6664> is in it.
Is there<WH3426> iniquity<WH5766> in my tongue<WH3956>? cannot my taste<WH2441> discern<WH995> perverse things<WH1942>?
